title: Haven Stress Testing Data
description: Large dataset for stress testing the Haven Starmap system with extreme volumes of data

test_scenarios: Deep planet/moon hierarchies (10+ moons per planet)

data.name: Maximum Load Test System Alpha
data.attributes: Class A Star, Binary System, Rich Resources, Extreme Temperature Variations

data.name: Extreme Long Text Test System
data.attributes: This system tests the handling of extremely long text fields to ensure the application can handle large amounts of data without crashing or experiencing performance degradation. The attributes field contains extensive information about stellar classification, age, composition, and various other astronomical properties that might be recorded during exploration and scientific analysis.

planets.name: Long Description Test Planet
planets.sentinel: Variable - Changes based on season, time of day, and recent disturbances. Generally moderate but can escalate to aggressive during mating seasons or territorial disputes.
planets.fauna: Extensive fauna catalog: Megafauna include the massive Titanosaur analogs reaching 50+ meters in length, aerial predators with 20-meter wingspans, deep ocean leviathans, bioluminescent cave dwellers, pack hunters with advanced coordination, solitary apex predators, herbivorous herd animals numbering in thousands, arboreal primates showing tool use, aquatic mammals with complex social structures, insectoid swarms, parasitic organisms, symbiotic species pairs, and over 10,000 catalogued species with new discoveries ongoing.
planets.flora: Complete botanical survey: Ancient forest giants reaching 200+ meters, carnivorous plants, medicinal herbs with xenobiological properties, crops compatible with human agriculture, toxic vegetation producing deadly neurotoxins, bioluminescent fungi creating underground light shows, aquatic plants forming vast kelp forests, desert succulents storing rare minerals, parasitic vines, nitrogen-fixing groundcover, flowering plants with extreme variety, rare specimens of scientific interest, and approximately 50,000 identified plant species.
planets.properties: Comprehensive planetary data: Breathable atmosphere (78% nitrogen, 20% oxygen, 2% other gases), gravity 1.1G, average temperature 22¬∞C with seasonal variations, active tectonic system, frequent volcanic activity in the southern hemisphere, stable magnetic field protecting from stellar radiation, three small natural satellites affecting tides, 26-hour day cycle, 380-day year, axial tilt 23.5¬∞ creating distinct seasons, large ocean coverage (65%), diverse biomes including tropical rainforests, temperate forests, grasslands, deserts, tundra, and polar ice caps, rich mineral deposits, geothermal energy sources, and complex weather patterns including monsoons and hurricanes.
planets.materials: Comprehensive resource catalog: Common elements (Iron, Carbon, Silicon, Aluminum, Calcium, Magnesium, etc.), Precious metals (Gold, Platinum, Silver, Palladium), Rare earth elements (complete lanthanide series), Radioactive materials (Uranium, Thorium), Exotic compounds (Superconducting crystals, Dark matter traces, Quantum-entangled particles), Organic resources (Petroleum analogs, Natural gas, Coal equivalents), Gemstones (Diamonds, Emeralds, Rubies, unique local varieties), Industrial minerals, and potentially revolutionary materials not found elsewhere in known space.
planets.base_location: Primary Settlement: New Haven City, Coordinates 0.0000¬∞N 0.0000¬∞E, Population 2.5 million, Established 2245. Secondary settlements: Northport (coastal, fishing and trade hub), Mining Colony 7 (mountain range, resource extraction), Research Station Delta (polar region, climate studies), Agricultural Zone Central (plains, food production), Orbital Station Alpha (space elevator terminal). Additional outposts scattered across all continents.
planets.notes: Extensive research notes: This planet represents one of the most successful colonization efforts in the Haven system. Initial surveys conducted in 2243 revealed exceptional habitability ratings. First landing team of 50 personnel established foothold on what is now New Haven City site. Early challenges included adaptation to 26-hour day cycle, dealing with aggressive fauna during mating season, and establishing crop compatibility. Major breakthrough in 2246 with discovery of local medicinal plants showing promise for human use. Population growth steady at 5% annually. Economic indicators strong with exports of rare materials and unique biological samples. Scientific research ongoing in 47 dedicated facilities. Cultural development includes local art movements inspired by bioluminescent lifeforms. Education system supports 125 schools and 3 universities. Healthcare excellent with avg life expectancy 95 years. Transportation network includes maglev trains, aerial shuttles, and space elevator. Energy primarily from geothermal and solar sources. Water purification from ocean desalination. Waste recycling at 95% efficiency. Political structure: democratic council with elected representatives. Security maintained by Colonial Defense Force. Recent discoveries include ancient ruins suggesting prior intelligent habitation, requiring archaeological investigation. Long-term outlook: positive with sustainable development plans for next 100 years. Recommended for continued colonization priority status.
